com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplz

Class PPLZ_IOUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.argox.sdk.barcodeprinter.emulation.pplz.PPLZ_IOUtil

  • public class PPLZ_IOUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the method of PPLZ emulator printer output/input related procedures. This class is used in PPLZ class.

    • Method Detail

      • printOut

        public final void printOut()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This function is used to output commands store the buffer to the connection. Then, upon completion, data in the buffer will be cleared. These commands come from the user calls the function conversion come.

        This function just output the data in the buffer to the connection. Hence, if you need the output print parameters, please call PPLZ_SetUtil.setPrintOut to set the values and modes to be output accordingly.

        When you need to output multiple label formats content, you can use combined mode as: PPLZ_SetUtil.setPrintOut + ... + PPLZ_SetUtil.setPrintOut + PPLZ_IOUtil.printOut.

        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterConnectionException - I/O error occurred.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - Failed to write data into connection.
        BarcodePrinterWriteTimeoutException - Write data timeout.
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        PPLZ_SetUtil.setPrintOut(int, int, int, boolean)

      • toArray

        public final byte[] toArray()
                     throws BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to return commands in the temporary storage area.
        Returns:
        [out] Return the byte array.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - Failed to write data into connection.

      • toArray

        public final byte[] toArray(boolean isClear)
                     throws BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to return commands in the temporary storage area.
        Parameters:
        isClear - [in] After returning the byte array, whether to clear the commands in the temporary storage area.
        Returns:
        [out] Return the byte array.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - Failed to write data into connection.

      • appendFile

        public final void appendFile(java.lang.String filePath)
                      throws BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException,
                             BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to append file data edited by the user to the end of the buffer.
        Parameters:
        filePath - [in] This is a file name, can be either absolute (recommend) path or relative path. Data type: Unicode.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException - Invalid parameter or parameter is out of the valid range.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error, or read file data failed.

      • appendData

        public final void appendData(byte[] array,
                             int offset,
                             int count)
                      throws BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException,
                             BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to append commands and data bytes edited by the user to the end of the buffer.
        Parameters:
        array - [in] The data to be written into the connection. Data type: byte array.
        offset - [in] The zero-based byte offset from 'array', used to start copying bytes into the current connection.
        count - [in] Number of bytes to be written into the current connection.
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterIllegalArgumentException - Invalid parameter or parameter is out of the valid range.
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error.

      • appendData

        public final void appendData(java.lang.String str)
                      throws BarcodePrinterGeneralException
        This function is used to append commands and data bytes edited by the user to the end of the buffer.
        Parameters:
        str - [in] The data to be written into the connection. Data type: Unicode, then the data will be output through the encoding set in BarcodePrinter.setEncoding().
        Throws:
        BarcodePrinterGeneralException - General error, byte array operation error.
